name: Alrighty, this is going to be a tough one.
author: Greengrin

posts.author: Greengrin
posts.content:
I'm looking for a shinobi-influenced class. UMD would be great. STR-based (hopefully, although I can deal with a dex-based) wielding either katana/light weapon OR 2H weapon. I would definitely prefer dual wielding though.

Idea is a character that can tear apart individual enmies, while being able to survive long enough to run from groups. Somewhat like a rus in, take out the target, disappear sort of character.

Main skills: Stealth, bluff, spot, UMD. Anything else is just cake.

Main role of the character (Role-playing wise) is arson/sabotage, intelligence gathering, and the (very) rare assassination.

Best items on are enhancements for clothes (boots, belt, rings, amulet, helmet, cloak, gloves) are +1 to two stats (i.e. +1 str, +1 dex, something like that)

Best weapons are +3 AB +6 slashing. Dev crit is not allowed, HiPS is not allowed, cleric is unwanted, mage/sorce unwanted.

Human is preferred.

Max level is level 30.

Classes have to be taken in groups of three starting. (3 rogue, then 3 fighter, then 1 rogue, 1 fighter, 2 rogue, 1 fighter, etc). No class can have less than three levels in it.

Thanks!

posts.author: foojin
posts.content:
Never made a level 30 build, so please keep that in mind. The build has nice damage output with EWS and SA, gets high stealth skills and a very nice initiative bonus. Also comes with some nice rogue bonus feats like CS. HiPS will make sure you can get away (in most cases). Also keeps 4 attacks per round.

Goal was to let you stealth in fullplate (not sure if this is good enough but just an idea). In case you need more stealth see if you can fit in stealthy (level 1 rogue feat).

In case you don't want HiPS it might be good to look at CoT instead of SD for more bonus feats and higher saves. I do think 10 CoT, 4 Fighter, 16 Rogue would be allot more powerful but since you wanted to get in and out fast.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Here is another options for you. Strength-based dual wielder with stealth skills. The build doesn't have as many feats as the Rogue/Fighter/CoT versions of Foojin and Max but offers an 11d6 Death Attack with a DC of 30. Saves, particularly Will, are low without the CoT bonuses. RP-wise, you'll obviously have to be Evil but you didn't mention that in your specifications. EWS delayed until the end to gain a Discipline dump and also to pump Assassin levels ASAP. 52 skill points left over for Bluff (not sure if there is a progression schedule), Open Locks, Disable/Set Traps and anything else you fancy.

posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:If it's for Arelith I think that getting access to a PrC is a little pita and it requires DM authorization.
From the reading I've done on the server, it does require DM authorization, but it's not that much of a pain. Oftentimes, there is just a sidequest they will ask you to do to earn the token that authorizes you the PrC. At least that is what I gathered from reading their server info from their website.
